images.copyright: Comet NEOWISE streaks across the sky over Sunwapta Lake in Jasper National Park, Alberta, Canada (© Stocktrek Images, Inc./Alamy)
images.title: Take in the mesmerizing sky
images.caption: Jasper Dark Sky Festival
images.desc: We're in Canada's Jasper National Park, one of the best stargazing spots in the world, to witness the Comet NEOWISE shooting across the night sky. NEOWISE, discovered on March 27, 2020, happens to be the brightest comet in Earth's northern skies since Comet Hale-Bopp became visible to the naked eye in 1997.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
tooltips.walls: Download this image. Use of this image is restricted to wallpaper only.
